unnormalised: Property registrations in Mumbai saw a whopping 25% jump in Oct'23, reaching a record 11,500 units! Turns out, even Mumbaikars are feeling the FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out) on owning a slice of this concrete jungle. Builders are probably popping champagne worth â‚¹50,000 a bottle right now.
normalised: Property registrations in Mumbai saw a whopping twenty five percent jump in October twenty twenty three, reaching a record eleven thousand five hundred units! Turns out, even Mumbaikars are feeling the F-O-M-O (Fear Of Missing Out) on owning a slice of this concrete jungle. Builders are probably popping champagne worth rupee fifty thousand a bottle right now.

unnormalised: The average property price also climbed by a modest 7%, so that 1BHK you were eyeing last week? Yeah, it's probably worth another Rs. 5 lakhs today. Maybe it's time to start a crowdfunding campaign or consider living in a slightly-less-prime location... like, maybe Thane. Just kidding (mostly)!
normalised: The average property price also climbed by a modest seven percent, so that one B-H-K you were eyeing last week? Yeah, it's probably worth another rupee five lakhs today. Maybe it's time to start a crowdfunding campaign or consider living in a slightly-less-prime location... like, maybe Thane. Just kidding (mostly)!

unnormalised: Market analysts are scratching their heads, muttering about "pent-up demand" and "favorable interest rates," but let's be honest, it's probably just good old-fashioned peer pressure. "Sharmaji bought a new flat in Bandra, beta! What are you waiting for?" Expect another surge around Diwali, when everyone suddenly decides they need a bigger space to store all those mithai boxes.

unnormalised: So, if you're thinking of buying property, maybe just sell a kidney or two? (Disclaimer: Don't actually do that). Or you know, just keep renting and enjoy the freedom of moving every 11 months when your landlord inevitably ups the rent by 15%. Good luck out there, property hunters! You'll need it.
